reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic hotel! Daria couldn't have been more helpful, rooms were great, roomy and very clean, breakfast was lovely, we even got fresh strawberrys! At the end of the day you can have a drink in the cosy lounge after strolling around beautiful Torri! Perfect location and amazing value for money, what more could you want from a 2* hotel!!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed at this lovely little hotel for a week, to attend a wedding. we have never been to italy before the resort itself is beautiful . the hotel is wonderful the rooms are basic but spotless and the family are great nothing is too much trouble for them and they go out of their way to make sure you have a good holiday.
reviews.title: fabulous family hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Al Castello for three days in early July. It was great.
reviews.title: Perfect location, extremely nice people and great service

reviews.text: The hotel's location is perfect, easy walking distance into Torri del Benaco for dinner every night. It was also directly across from the ferry pier that runs across the lake to Maderno. It's a simple hotel, nothing too fancy, always very clean. Oh, they have a nice little (free) parking lot.
reviews.title: !Super!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The family who runs the hotel is really what makes it special. Whether we had a question about town, or needed extra towels...or anything...they were always helpful and nice. My wife speaks Italian, but I don't--so whenever they noticed I was interested in the conversation--they would switch to English for my benefit. Very nice.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time on Lake Garda, wasn't sure where to stay in the masses towns and villages. Chose Torri because it seemed one of the less-touristy areas.
reviews.title: Fantastic Customer Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having not read much on this hotel, booked with some trepidation. Need not have worried; booked direct with the Hotel, who kept in touch via mail.
reviews.title: Small friendly, family run hotel.... loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just returned from a week in Torri del Benaco staying at the Hotel al Costello. What a fanastic resort & what a fantastic hotel! This may only be a two star hotel but I doubt you will find a better one in this part of the world unless you spend a huge amount more. Why? Well the staff running the hotel could not be more helpful or friendly; the food is absolutely terrific itallian home cooked fayre; the location is perfect close to the lake, resort centre & the rooms are clean airy & comfortable. What more could you want?
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel Al Costello

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the top floor (308) that has a balcony & a great view so if I stay again I would ask for a room on the upper floor.
reviews.title: Charming and friendly!

likes.disliked: — Small outside area but very close to the lake so not really an issue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the reviews of this hotel we were looking forward to staying here but thought perhaps the reviews were a little optimistic. How wrong could we be - the hotel was absolutely great, although basic, but what do you expect for a 2* establishment. It was clean and bright, very welcoming and friendly. The family who own and run the Al Castello were charming and nothing was too much trouble for them. Our flight was delayed but they kept meals for us all (a delicious artichoke lasagne and pannacotta for desert) even though it was well outside their dining hours. The food was excellent throughout and the portions were more than adequate - in fact 3 courses were occasionally too much! The whole experience represented good value for money - it was close to all amenities - and we would certainly recommend the Al Castello to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Family Run Hotel

likes.liked: — Family run Hotel - Staff were great

reviews.title: Excellent service
reviews.text: It isn't a five star luxury hotel, but it is a friendly, family run hotel, the rooms are cleaned every day to a high standard, we were on a half board package and the food was great both at breakfast and dinner including service.
